44777 N Gratiot Ave,
Clinton Township, MI, 48036-1362
Re: License #: CP500201269
Dear Ms. Price:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
9/23/2025. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• No Technical Assistance was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No Consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted 4 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special investigation #2024SIC0001523, dated 10/8/24 and CAP approved
10/25/24. The agency was in violation with Rules 400.12325(1) License
2

Recommendation and 400.12327 (1) (a) Special Investigation. There were no
repeat violations this reporting period.
Special investigation #2025SIC0000601, dated 5/29/25 and CAP approved 6/11/25.
The agency was in violation with Rule 400.12206 (2) Staff qualification, volunteer,
contractors on central registry. There were no repeat violations this reporting
period.
Special investigation #2025SIC0000439, dated 5/30/25 and CAP approved 6/6/25.
The agency was in violation with Rule 400.12214 Compliance with the child
protection law. There were no repeat violations this reporting period.
Renewal Inspection report dated 9/9/24, CAP approved 9/10/24. The agency was in
violation with FOM Policy 722.08D Treatment plans – agreement and signatures.
There were no repeat violations this reporting period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator (CA)
reported Macomb has established a training unit to provide the necessary support
for new hires and during this reporting period several vacancies were filled.
However, nine child welfare staff left their foster care positions creating additional
openings and two were in first line supervision. Chief Administrator reported some
of the departures were related to promotions, other interests outside the State of
Michigan and others were related to performance and labor relation issues. Chief
Administrator reported the ongoing weekly monitoring and tracking spreadsheet
has continued to help organize and prioritize dates for necessary follow up when
warranted. She said it is accessible to all supervisors to help when staff are out on
extended leave.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews:
Staff interviewed reported their supervisors and coworkers were their biggest
support system. They enjoy the flexibility provided to them to work their cases. The
staff expressed their feelings around transition of staff and the amount of paperwork
that is assigned, making it hard to keep up at times. Staff reported they do their part
to maintain compliance within the agency with caseloads. Overall, the staff reported
the environment is good and did not have any suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has sufficient office space and equipment to perform the job functions.
The case files & CHRI records are stored in locked cabinets to prevent
unauthorized access.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were three safety alerts:
Safety Alert 1:
Concern:
A new firearm was brought into the home in December. The firearm is not properly
stored. The foster parent indicated there was another weapon in the home owned
by her son, she is not aware of where the weapon is stored.
Resolution:
A special investigation # 2025SEC0000686 was assigned to the licensing team and
the licensing staff went to the home on 6/20/2025 and verified all guns were secured
with trigger locks and the family was provided a lockbox for ammunition. The
caregivers were instructed to put all guns in a location that was inaccessible to the
children. Locks will be installed on all bedroom doors that have guns to ensure the
guns are inaccessible. Licensing staff went to the home and verified the locks have
been installed.
Safety Alert 2:
Concern:
There are no operable smoke detector and no operable carbon monoxide detector in
the caregiver’s home.
Resolution:
A smoke detector and carbon monoxide alarm were taken to the home on August 6,
2025, by the assigned foster care worker. At the time of the home visit the relative
caregiver had already had a dual smoke/CO2 alarm taped to the ceiling outside the
youth’s bedroom. This alarm was tested and appeared to be in working order.
Safety Alert 3:
Concern:
The relative caregiver did not have an operable smoke detector in the basement.
Resolution:
The assigned foster care worker made contact with the caregiver on 7/8/2025. New
smoke detector was brought to the relative caregiver’s home and installed at the
bottom of the stairs.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
9/23/2025
